backendDatabase

Class PlayerBackend

  • java.lang.Object
    • backendDatabase.PlayerBackend

  • public class PlayerBackend
extends java.lang.Object
    The Backend player database reads and writes to the mySQL database in order to manage the player information, excluding statistics.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayerBackend()
      Constructor for building a backend player database.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean changeProfileDetails(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String databaseField, int newInfo)
      The method pulls the specific information from the database field specified by the player or the other classes that interact with it
      boolean changeProfileDetails(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String databaseField, java.lang.String newInfo)
      The method changes the profile details depending on the databasefield which could be a password, security question, security answer or level achieved(only called from game play since the user has no access to it).
      boolean checkLogin(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password)
      This method checks the database for possible matching username and password combinations and returns true if it finds false, otherwise
      boolean checkSecurityQuestion(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String securityAnswer)
      The method checks the security question inputted by the user with the one saved in the database when the user has previously logged in

      createPlayer creates a new entry in the database with the information passed through its parameters.
      boolean findPlayer(java.lang.String username)
      findPlayer searches the database for a username matching the one entered by the player.
      java.lang.String getInfo(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String databaseField)
      The method pulls the specific information from the database field specified by the player or the other classes that interact with it
      boolean removePlayer(java.lang.String username)
      The method deletes all the information of a player corresponding to a specific username

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayerBackend

        public PlayerBackend()
        Constructor for building a backend player database. It connects to the mySQL Server to establish the connection.

    • Method Detail

      • checkLogin

        public boolean checkLogin(java.lang.String username,
                 java.lang.String password)
        This method checks the database for possible matching username and password combinations and returns true if it finds false, otherwise
        Parameters:
        username - the username inputed into the text field
        password - the password inputed into password field
        Returns:
        whether or not the username and password combination was found

      • findPlayer

        public boolean findPlayer(java.lang.String username)
        findPlayer searches the database for a username matching the one entered by the player.
        Parameters:
        username - the username inputted by the player
        Returns:
        true if it finds a matching entry in the database, false otherwise

      • createPlayer

        public boolean createPlayer(java.lang.String newUsername,
                   java.lang.String newPassword,
                   java.lang.String securityQuestion,
                   java.lang.String securityAnswer)
        createPlayer creates a new entry in the database with the information passed through its parameters. It will also autoset the level achieved field to 1.
        Parameters:
        newUsername - player inputted Username
        newPassword - player inputted Password
        securityQuestion - player inputted Security Question
        securityAnswer - player inputted Answer to
        Returns:
        true if an entry has been created, false otherwise

      • checkSecurityQuestion

        public boolean checkSecurityQuestion(java.lang.String username,
                            java.lang.String securityAnswer)
        The method checks the security question inputted by the user with the one saved in the database when the user has previously logged in
        Parameters:
        username - the username inputed by the player
        securityAnswer - the securityAnswers inputted by the player
        Returns:
        true if the security questions are the same, false otherwise

      • changeProfileDetails

        public boolean changeProfileDetails(java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String databaseField,
                           java.lang.String newInfo)
        The method changes the profile details depending on the databasefield which could be a password, security question, security answer or level achieved(only called from game play since the user has no access to it).
        Parameters:
        username - the username inputted by the player
        databaseField - the field in the database, whose info needs to be changed.
        newInfo - the new information that needs to be stored in the database field that needs to be changed
        Returns:
        true if the change of the profile details was changed successfully, false otherwise

      • getInfo

        public java.lang.String getInfo(java.lang.String username,
                       java.lang.String databaseField)
        The method pulls the specific information from the database field specified by the player or the other classes that interact with it
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the specific user whose information needs to be pulled
        databaseField - the string database field whose information needs to be pulled
        Returns:
        a string representing the info that is stored inside the database field of the specific user

      • changeProfileDetails

        public boolean changeProfileDetails(java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String databaseField,
                           int newInfo)
        The method pulls the specific information from the database field specified by the player or the other classes that interact with it
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the specific user whose information needs to be pulled
        databaseField - the int field whose information needs to be pulled
        Returns:
        a string representing the info that is stored inside the database field of the specific user

      • removePlayer

        public boolean removePlayer(java.lang.String username)
        The method deletes all the information of a player corresponding to a specific username
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the player that needs to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the player is removed, false otherwise
